title: Justin Timberlake And The AC/DC Rule
excerpt: A lesson from the Australian classic rockers explains why the pop star's newest album, which hasn't generated glowing reviews or massive radio hits, still had an explosive opening sales week.

title: Is Old Music Killing New Music? - by Ted Gioia
excerpt: All the growth in the music business now comes from old songs—with consumption of new music actually shrinking. How did we get here, and is there a way back?

title: Skip Rates: Why The First 30 Seconds Matter More Than Ever
excerpt: With the album on the wane and attention spans shorter than ever, the first 30 seconds of of a song matter more than.  Not only do they need to capture. Continue reading
